key_risks: Dependence on global travel, making the business vulnerable to disruptions such as pandemics, geopolitical tensions, or economic downturns
High debt levels due to aggressive expansion, raising concerns about financial stability and flexibility
Regulatory and competitive pressures in the duty-free industry, including varying taxation policies and competition from online shopping
Labor disputes over wages and working conditions, posing reputational and operational risks
controversies: Criticism over labor practices, including wages and working conditions for retail staff
Concerns about financial stability due to high leverage from acquisitions like Autogrill
environmental_issues: Reducing plastic waste and promoting sustainable products
social_issues: Labor practices, including wages and working conditions
Ensuring the right to rest and family life for employees
governance_issues: High debt levels and financial stability concerns
Management of aggressive expansion strategy and its impact on financial flexibility

sources.title: Avolta - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: Avolta AG (until November 2023: Dufry AG) is a Swiss-based travel retailer which operates duty-free and duty-paid shops and convenience stores in airports, cruise lines, seaports, railway stations and central tourist areas. The company, headquartered in Basel, employs almost 36,000 people and operates in over 65 countries worldwide.It is publicly traded on the SIX Swiss Exchange.
